revised_title: Exploring the Genetics and Physiology of Angiosperm Incompatibility Systems
tldr: This article discusses the genetics and physiology of angiosperm self-incompatibility systems, which prevent self-fertilization in flowering plants. It explores two main types of self-incompatibility systems: gametophytic and sporophytic, and examines how they function at the cellular level. The article also highlights the importance of cell surface interactions and communication in these systems, and the role of large molecules in plant cell communication.
